job_description:
English text follows below Dutch text
Ben jij nog lang niet klaar met leren en wil jij jezelf voortdurend blijven ontwikkelen en uitdagen? Dan is het Finance & Risk Traineeship bij NN Group de perfecte start van je carrière!
Bij NN zijn wij er voor onze klanten bij grote veranderingen in hun leven. Bijvoorbeeld bij het kopen van een huis, gezinsuitbreiding of een pensioen. Als Finance & Risk trainee bij NN Group draag je dus bij aan zeken die ertoe doen en word je klaargestoomd als leider van de toekomst. Daarom zijn we opzoek naar trainees die zich inleven in onze klanten, initiatief nemen en niet snel opgeven, jou dus!
Het Programma
Onze trainees zijn onze toekomstige leiders. Tijdens het tweejarig traineeship zet je de eerste stappen in je ontwikkeling naar deze toekomst. Je doet drie opdrachten bij drie verschillende afdelingen. Eén van die opdrachten kan ook in het buitenland zijn, bijvoorbeeld in Madrid, Athene of Praag. Hierdoor leer je het hele bedrijf goed kennen, bouw je een groot netwerk op en word je op zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijk vlak flink uitgedaagd. Na deze drie rotaties ga je aan de slag in een vaste functie.
Daarnaast neem je samen met je mede-trainees deel aan het ‘Future Leaders Programme’. Dit ontwikkeltraject draait vooral om persoonlijk leiderschap; je persoonlijke groei als professional en als toekomstig leider van NN. Naast het FLP volg je trainingen waarbij verschillende onderwerpen aan bod komen, zoals projectmanagement, stakeholdermanagement of data & AI. Om je leercurve zo steil mogelijk te maken heb je verder een senior leader als mentor en word je gecoacht door onze trainee managers.
Jouw Ontwikkeling
Door je opdrachten, het intensieve ontwikkelprogramma, je coach en mentor geven we je de tools om het verschil te maken binnen NN en jezelf snel te ontwikkelen. Je wordt continu uitgedaagd en doet in korte tijd veel kennis, ervaringen en waardevolle inzichten op. En je bent niet de enige, je doet dit samen met je mede-trainees. Aan het eind van het traineeship ben je onderdeel van een hechte groep vrienden met wie je je altijd verbonden zult voelen.
Jouw impact als trainee
Als Finance & Risk trainee werk je in een kennisrijke omgeving bij een van onze afdelingen voor Finance of Risk. Je eerste rotatie van een jaar vinden wij voor je, waarbij we kijken naar je achtergrond, je vaardigheden en je ontwikkeling. Voor je tweede en je derde opdracht van zes maanden sta je zelf aan het roer, die mag je vormgeven naar jouw interesses en leerdoelen. Je kunt werken bij een Business Unit in Nederland, bijvoorbeeld bij Pensioenen of Schade of bij een van onze expertise kantoren op het gebied van data science of actuariaat in het buitenland, maar ook bij onze merken zoals OHRA en Movir. Uiteraard kun je ook terecht op ons hoofdkantoor in Den Haag, bijvoorbeeld bij Group Risk. Je kunt dus overal in onze organisatie werken, er is geen vaste route!
Wat wel vast staat, is dat je heel veel zult leren van de expertise van je collega’s. De wereld van Finance en Risk bij een verzekeraar is zeer complex en uitdagend. Bij elke opdracht doe je weer een schat aan kennis op. Je zult flink worden uitgedaagd, heel veel leren in korte tijd en je analytische skills maximaal inzetten!
Voorbeelden van onderwerpen waar je aan zou kunnen werken zijn:
Risk management
Pricing
Data analysis
Asset and liability management
Modelling
Business intelligence
Reporting
IFRS17
Wat je meebrengt
Om een van onze toekomstige leiders te worden breng je de volgende ervaring en kwaliteiten mee:
Universitaire Master in een kwantitatief gebied (Bijvoorbeeld Finance / Econometrie / Actuarial science / Wiskunde / Natuurkunde / Quantitative finance / Economie).
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden
Kritisch denken
Probleemoplossend vermogen
Proactiviteit
Wendbaarheid
Verder heb je een Masterdiploma of verwacht je vóór 1 september 2023 af te studeren en heb je maximaal twee jaar werkervaring vanaf je afstudeerdatum. Daarnaast spreek en schrijf je goed Engels. Jouw motivatie voor NN en het traineeship vinden we belangrijk en hoe jouw persoonlijke vaardigheden van waarde kunnen zijn voor onze klanten en NN Group.
Wat bieden wij jou?
Startsalaris van €3095,- bruto (op basis van 36 uur) en gunstige secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden
Dertiende maand en vakantiegeld bovenop je bruto salaris
Drie rotaties; je hebt de mogelijkheid om verschillende onderdelen van onze organisatie te zien (NN Group breed).
Een intensief persoonlijk ontwikkelprogramma inclusief trainingsweken, individuele coaching en mentoring en een individueel opleidingsbudget
Zichtbaarheid; tijdens het traineeship maak je kennis met senior leiders via het mentorprogramma en verschillende evenementen
Een internationale omgeving
Een tweejarig contract, met de intentie om deze om te zetten in een vast contract na het Traineeship
Ruimte om bij te dragen aan de maatschappij, bijvoorbeeld door vrijwilligerswerk te doen tijdens werktijd
Solliciteer direct!
Ben je geïnteresseerd en herken je jezelf hierin? Solliciteer door te beginnen met de eerste ronde, de NN Talent Pitch, via de oranje button bovenaan de pagina.
De selectieprocedure ziet er als volgt uit:
The NN Talent Pitch (open tot 27 maart 2023, 23:59h)
Interviews met HR & Business (3 - 25 april 2023)
Talent Selectie Dagen (8 - 11 mei 2023)
Start Traineeship (1 september 2023)
Let op: sollicitaties via e-mail worden niet in behandeling genomen.
Neem voor meer informatie over het Traineeship en/of de selectieprocedure contact op met Pauline ter Avest (Graduate Recruiter Traineeship) via traineeship@nn-group.com.
We staan niet open voor interim/freelance opdrachten en/of kandidaten of acquisitie door bureaus. Alvast dank voor uw begrip.
-
Finance & Risk Trainee at NN Group
Are you eager to learn and looking for ways in which you can challenge and develop yourself? Then the Traineeship at NN Group is the perfect start to your career. At NN, we are there for our clients during major changes in life. For example when buying a house, expanding your family or planning your retirement. As a Finance & Risk trainee you will contribute to issues that matter and are prepared to become a future leader. That is why we are looking for trainees that empathize with our clients, take initiative and do not give up easily. In other words, we are looking for you!
The programme
Our trainees are our future leaders. During the 2-year programme you will take the first steps towards becoming this future leader. You will have three assignments in three different departments throughout the programme. One of those assignments could also be abroad, for example in Madrid, Athens or Prague. Your assignments will challenge you and accelerate your personal development and knowledge. After these three assignments, you will start in a fixed position.
Next to the assignments, you and your fellow trainees will also be part of the Future Leadership Programme. This programme is all about your personal leadership; your growth as a person, as a professional and as a future leader. In addition to the FLP, you and your fellow trainees will have training weeks in which a variety of subjects such as project management, stakeholder management and data & AI will be covered. And the training doesn’t stop there! To fully equip you for becoming successful in the area of Finance and Risk at NN, your colleagues will give you expert trainings on topics such as IFRS17, Solvency, pricing etc. And on top of all of this, you will also be coached by one of our senior leaders and the trainee manager throughout the Traineeship.
Your development
Your assignments, intensive development programme, coaches and exposure to senior leadership all contribute to you making an impact on the business and to developing yourself more quickly. You are continuously challenged and gain a lot of knowledge, experience and valuable insights in a short period of time. And this is a trajectory which you will be sharing with your fellow trainees. At the end of your Traineeship, you will be part of a close group of friends that will last your entire career at NN.
Your impact as a trainee
As a Finance & Risk trainee, you will be able to work in a high expertise environment within our Risk and Finance departments. Your first rotation will be found by us based on your background, skills and development and will span the first year. For you second and third assignment you will be in charge of finding a position which suits your interests and learning objectives yourself. For example, you can work at one of our Business Units in the Netherlands such as Pensions or Non-Life or at one of our expertise offices abroad in the field of data science or actuarial sciences. Alternatively, you could choose to work at one of our brands such as OHRA or Movir. Of course, you can also decide to go to our head office in The Hague, for example at Group Risk. Long story short, there is no pre-set path; you can work anywhere in the organisation and can tailor the Traineeship to match with your ambitions and desires.
Throughout each assignment you will work with the many domain experts which will allow your knowledge in these fields to grow enormously. Prepare to be challenged, learn a lot in a short time and apply your analytical skills to the fullest!
Some examples of areas you could work in are:
Risk management
Pricing
Data analysis
Asset and liability management
Modelling
Business intelligence
Reporting
IFRS17 etc.
Who you are
To become one of our future leaders in Risk or Finance, you bring the following experience and skills to the Traineeship:
University Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Finance / Econometrics / Actuarial science / Mathematics / Physics / Quantitative finance / Economics)
Strong communication skills
Critical thinker
Problem solving
Pro-active
Resilient
Furthermore, you have a Master’s degree or expect to obtain this before 1 September 2023 and a maximum of two years of work experience from your graduation date. Your motivation for NN and the traineeship are important to us, next to how your personal skills can be of value to our customers and NN.
What we offer
Base salary of €3095,- gross (based on a 36-hour contract) and favourable secondary working conditions
Thirteenth month and holiday allowance on top of your gross salary
Development of your financial, actuarial, digital and risk capabilities in one of the leading insurance companies
Three job rotations, you'll have the possibility to see different departments of our organisation
An intensive development programme focusing on personal development, including training weeks, individual coaching, mentoring and a buddy, as well as knowledge
Exposure to senior leaders through mentorship and events
An international work environment
A 2-year contract with the intention to convert it to a permanent contract after the Traineeship ends
Time to contribute to society, for example by volunteering during working hours
Apply now
Are you interested and do you recognise yourself in all that is mentioned above? Apply directly by starting the first round, the NN Talent Pitch, via the orange button at the top of the page.
The selection procedure will be as follows:
The NN Talent Pitch (open until March 27, 2023, 23:59h)
Interviews with HR & Business (from April 3 - April 25, 2023)
Talent Selection Days (from May 8 - May 11, 2023)
Start Traineeship (1st of September, 2023)
Note that applications via e-mail will not be considered.
For more information regarding the Traineeship and/or selection procedure, please contact Pauline ter Avest (Graduate Recruiter Traineeship) via traineeship@nn-group.com.

In this role you will prepare financial analysis and reports for the NN Group Management board on business performance using Solvency-II (OCG), IFRS-17 and sales (VNB) metrics. In this very varied job, you will work on multiple projects enhancing insights to the financial performance of NN Group and their business units from a reporting as well as forecasting and business planning perspective.

The salary for this position is between € 4.332,- and € 6.189,- depending on your knowledge and experience. This is based on a 36-hour work week, excluding a 13th month and vacation pay.
Your impact as Financial Specialist Performance and Analytics at NN Group
The most exciting part of this job is de multi-scope role you will have, the insight you will have in all relevant financial impacts of the Group and the close contact with senior management. First and foremost, you are an financial specialist who will contribute to the analysis of the financial performance of NN Group both backward as forward looking. In addition, you are the advisor on financial and business related matters to the business units and relevant NN Group leadership. Your contributions to the financial performance reporting are of a high level, predominantly focused on key business drivers and mainly aimed to provide clear and actionable insights. All the while, you will play an important role in shaping the scope and implementation of IFRS17. For this part, you will write IFRS17 reports for senior management or analyze business units IFRS-17 reports. Moreover, you are writing internal IFRS-17 guidance (for instance Margin Analysis) and discuss IFRS-17 figures with business units.
Our Performance and Analytics team focuses on:
Drafting the Quarterly Performance Report in which business performance of all NN Group’s business units is discussed
Drafting the multi-year business plan for NN Group from an IFRS-17, Capital Generation and sales perspective
Analyze financial performance metrics and challenge business units on initiatives to improve performance (for example OCG, but also expenses)
Perform operational consolidation on the Solvency-II balance sheet of NN Group as well as analyzing operating capital generation (OCG)
Contribute to strategic projects of NN Group mainly from a financial point of view
Compare and report upon business performance compared to plan, past and forecast for both internal and external disclosure purposes
And we do a lot more, which gives you great opportunities to develop even further and have a very diversified role.
Your responsibilities
You will be business unit contact for one of the Dutch business units to understand and analyze the business and challenge on business driven actions to improve financial result
You will perform analysis on the financial result of NN Group and its business units to determine business driven actions for improvement
You will write financial reports for NN Group senior management on Solvency II (Operating Capital Generation), IFRS-17 both backward looking and forward looking
You will be involved in the IFRS-17 project to further implement IFRS-17
You will maintain and update Solvency-II consolidation tools together with the team members. In the quarterly reporting periods you are performing the consolidation of the Solvency II Balance Sheet and Own Capital Generation of NN Group
You will be involved in other projects. Examples of these projects are to draft the business plan for NN Group or to further improve management reporting processes
Your colleagues
You become part of our 12-person team Performance and Analytics. We are quite an international team with six different nationalities. In this role you will be part of the subteam focusing on NN Group and the Dutch business units consisting of 6 persons headed by the Manager Finance Business Performance.
Every Thursday, we work at the office; the other days you decide yourself, because that depends on your cooperation with other colleagues within NN.
The department Performance and Analytics is led by the Head of Performance & Analytics and directly reports to the Chief Financial Officer of NN Group.
Who you are
As a driven person, you have the mentality to get things done and to connect with others to succeed in your role. We can describe you as a team player who is able to collaborate effectively with both colleagues in (Group) Finance and Risk, colleagues in the Dutch business units as well as senior management. You also have:
An academic master’s degree in Econometrics, Actuarial Science, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree
A minimum of 4 years of experience gained insurance and experience in Solvency II and/or IFRS-17
Strong analytical and numerical skills to challenge and explain Solvency II and IFRS-17 results and identify business drivers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (in English) and the ability to communicate with and report to senior stakeholders
Very good command of Excel
Continue developing
It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career and as a person. We help you with:
Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre
A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you
The autonomy to steer your own development path
Employee benefits
You are more than a colleague, and that is something we understand very well at NN. You have many roles in life, leading to different choices. At NN we give you the opportunity to select employee benefits that are important to you. In consultation with your manager and your direct colleagues, you can work from any location at any time. You get enough flexibility to adjust your working pattern to your personal needs. In addition, you will receive:
Collective pension scheme with a personal contribution of only 6%
194.4 hours of leave, based on a 36-hour week (that’s 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week) and one Diversity Day
Holiday allowance and a 13th month paid with your monthly salary
NS Business Card 2nd class, giving you unlimited travel 7 days a week. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometers travelled for business and commuting.
All NN colleagues work in a hybrid form: on average two days at the office and working from home (or anywhere else). The official location for this job is our fantastic office in The Hague. The office is located next to the A12, but is also easily accessible by public transport. Want to catch some fresh air? You can take the tram or bike and you will be at the beach in half an hour.
Will you be our new colleague?
We would like to invite you to have a cup of coffee or tea. Because we believe that your enthusiasm about this position will only increase during that conversation. So, what are you waiting for?
Apply now
If you have any questions about the vacancy you can reach out to Kamiel van Langen, Manager Performance & Analytics via 06 15416400. Any questions about the process can be directed to Joyce van der Burg, Recruiter via joyce.van.der.burg@nn-group.com

Beschrijving van het bericht:

Actuary
Amsterdam | 32-38,75h (is fulltime) | between € 3.500,- and € 5.000,-
As an Actuary you will be part of an industry-leading team and you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions with a focus on reserve and capital calculations for the financial sector. Challenging? Definitely.
Your responsibilities
Aon’s PathWise offers the financial sector state-of-the-art software and consulting with quants in actuarial and data science, engineering, hedging, ICT, and asset management. Global clients use our extremely fast PathWise platform based on GPU’s for pricing, valuation, forecasting, hedging, and ALM. Our stochastic economic scenario generators, asset & liability management, big data semi-SQL database, and strong relationship with Amazon and NVIDIA empower thousands.
You will report directly to the Managing Director and Account Director.
As an Actuary / Data Scientist you will have the next job responsibilities:
Key Services
Create financial models in PathWise, focusing on reserve and capital calculations for the financial sector
Further the development of robust processes for hedging, strategic asset allocation, scenario generator calibration, insurance company financial reporting, etc.
Participate in the expansion of PathWise functionality as the need arises or as requested by clients
Develop and maintain Economic Scenario Generators (ESGs) used in the valuation of financial assets and insurance liabilities
Client Implementation Projects
Create Python scripts to handle input & output, dynamic management information dashboards, and automation of model runs for e.g. sensitivity & movement analysis and scenario generation
Provide hands-on training for PathWise users and develop standalone training reference material
Identify shortfalls in company processes and propose improvements
Troubleshoot issues as they arise during PathWise migrations, focusing on providing a strong initial user experience
Business Development Support
Participate in demonstrations to potential clients
Develop models specific to client requirements for demo’s and onboarding
Participate in industry, academic and internal research projects
Develop and deliver presentations on emerging issues pertaining to the insurance industry and the financial services industry
Attend industry and client conferences to keep informed on industry changes and Python packages
Job Requirements:
At least five (5) years of experience working in the Financial Sector in a pricing/hedging/valuation role working with financial guarantees embedded in life insurance products
You are experienced in working with IFRS 17 (hard criteria)
A Bachelors or Master degree
Python programming experience
In the position of ambition to obtain a CFA designation or equivalent
Derivatives knowledge
Speaking multiple languages is a plus
About the department/company
Aon Pathwise
PathWise Solutions Group (PSG) is part of Aon Reinsurance. PSG provides high productivity computing software, consulting services as well as advisory services to financial intermediaries, primarily insurance companies. PSG’s high-performance software platform, PathWise™, provides companies with the ability to easily model financial obligations without involved coding and is run on Graphical Processing Units (GPU), making it the fastest, readily available software platform currently in use in the insurance industry. We work in small teams and emphasis the importance of knowledge sharing with your colleagues. You will be working with a team of 5 colleagues.
Aon Netherlands
Aon is the leading advisor in risk, pension and health solutions. Aon is the largest insurance broker in the Netherlands. We help customers to achieve their goals more easily. Aon enables colleagues to develop and be successful together within an inclusive work environment. What sets Aon apart is knowledge, data and the people. At Aon, we’re in the business of better decisions. We shape decisions for the better — to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.
The offer
At Aon we realize that no one is the same, which is why we offer a flexible salary component in addition to the fixed monthly salary. You can use this for a variety of purposes, including a gross payment, extra vacation days or extra pension.
In addition, we offer:
A salary between € 3.500,- and € 5.000,- gross per month, depending on your experience;
A attractive bonus scheme;
A non-contributory pension;
A sustainable employability budget;
The possibility to work from home for part of the working week;
A lot of room to determine independently and together with your team how you want to work;
Different options to develop yourself;
More information
Apply directly be using the ‘Apply Now’ button. We would like to receive your resumé and motivation.
For more information about the procedure or vacancy you can contact Jaco de Pee at jaco.de.pee@aon.com.
#LI-JDP2

Beschrijving van het bericht:

Amsterdam | 38,75u (is fulltime) | between € 5.500,- and € 9.100,- gross per month (ex. secundary benefits)
Aon is looking for a Director, Client Services and Production Management
As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions supporting Reinsurance Solutions. This position is based in our Amsterdam location.
Your impact as a Director, Client Services and Production Management
Job Responsibilities:
Establishing and maintaining strong client relationships and ensure all clients environment SLAs are met on a day to day basis; a team effort to be smoothly executed in PathWise on existing processes such as monthly pricing, valuation, and capital cycles, ALM, ORSA, and hedging. IFRS 17 knowledge is a must.
You report into the local MD.
Applying a consultative sales approach to engage with existing clients to identify their strategic needs and priorities and working closely with stakeholders to develop solutions to build value.
Hosting face-to-face or virtual sales meetings between clients and the production team;
Working with a team and sharing knowledge with more junior colleagues in order to build and run new models, products, and processes for and with clients. Irregular travel is required to on-sites in EMEA.
Working with PSG software engineering, IT operations, and actuarial and quantitative modeling teams to propose, estimate, and deliver services to clients.
Responsible for projects including team steering, deadlines, deliverables, and tracking issues for complex customer projects involving multiple customers with multiple departments.
Ensuring client and internal approvals processes, and environment controls are followed properly and in a timely manner according to contract SLAs;
Ensuring changes to projects, products, systems and operations are accurately managed.
Working closely with senior management and executive sponsor to ensure clear understanding of program delivery objectives and any constraints that may exist for successful delivery of products and services.
Job Requirements:
A university degree in a quantitative or related subject area (actuarial science, econometrics, statistics, mathematics, or computer science) is required
Experience with actuarial modeling software and actuarial reporting processes is required
CERA, CFA, VBA, ASA or FSA designation is desired for this role
A minimum of 7 years’ experience in actuarial modeling, reporting or consulting role working with life and/or non-life insurance products
Python programming experience and proven project management skills
The ideal candidate with have experience in European insurance products and (regulatory) reporting frameworks. Having asset (derivative) knowledge is a pre.
Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, both verbally and written; in English and ideally Dutch fluently, and other languages such as Spanish/German/Italian is a pre.
About the department/company
Aon Pathwise
PathWise Solutions Group (PSG) is part of Aon Reinsurance. PSG provides high productivity computing software, consulting services as well as advisory services to financial intermediaries, primarily insurance companies. PSG’s high-performance software platform, PathWise™, provides companies with the ability to easily model financial obligations without involved coding and is run on Graphical Processing Units (GPU), making it the fastest, readily available software platform currently in use in the insurance industry. We work in small teams and emphasis the importance of knowledge sharing with your colleagues. You will be working with a team of 5 colleagues.
Aon Netherlands
Aon is the leading advisor in risk, pension and health solutions. Aon is the largest insurance broker in the Netherlands. We help customers to achieve their goals more easily. Aon enables colleagues to develop and be successful together within an inclusive work environment. What sets Aon apart is knowledge, data and the people. At Aon, we’re in the business of better decisions. We shape decisions for the better — to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.
The offer
The salary scale for this role is between € 5.500,- and € 9.100,- gross per month. The exact salary depends on experience and knowledge. At Aon we realize that no one is the same, which is why we offer a flexible salary component in addition to the fixed monthly salary. This flexibele component equals a value of 19,21% of your salary. You can use this for a variety of purposes, including a gross payment, extra vacation days or extra pension.
In addition, we offer:
A attractive bonus scheme;
A non-contributory pension;
A sustainable employability budget;
The possibility to work from home for part of the working week;
A lot of room to determine independently and together with your team how you want to work;
Different options to develop yourself;
More information
Apply directly be using the ‘Apply Now’ button. We would like to receive your resumé and motivation.
For more information about the procedure or vacancy you can contact Jaco de Pee at jaco.de.pee@aon.com.
For more information about working at Aon in the Netherlands, visit: www.werkenbijaon.nl.
#LI-JDP2
#INSERT-LI-JDP2-HERE

We are looking for an experienced Risk Model Developer within NN Schade & Inkomen who is eager to continuously improve the risk model landscape by further developing the existing risk models as well as by implementing new initiatives. Does this sound like you? Apply now!
This job offers you a monthly salary between € 5,175 and € 7,393 depending on your experience. This is based on a 36-hour work week, excluding a 13th month and holiday allowance.
Your impact as Risk Model Developer at NN
RMD is responsible for the development and maintenance of the non-life specific risk models of the Partial Internal Model of NN Group. With these risk models, related to for example morbidity or persistency, you provide useful insights to senior management and have a great impact on the strategic management of NN Schade & Inkomen. In addition, you closely collaborate with colleagues within Risk, Finance and the various business lines.
Your responsibilities
Development, implementation and maintenance of the non-life specific risk models as part of the Partial Internal Model of NN Group
You pro-actively propose improvements to the existing risk models as well as identify new risks
Smooth handovers of the model updates to the reporting teams within Finance that use these models in the reporting processes
Further mature the processes related to risk model development
Who you are
A quantitative Master’s degree, preferably in Actuarial Science, Econometrics or Mathematics
A minimum of 5 years of experience in (non-life) risk modelling within a Solvency II context
Excellent English communication skills, in writing and verbal
Pro-active and collaborative
Your colleagues
You will be part of the RMD team that has been established per January 1st 2022 and which is part of the Risk Management department within NN Schade & Inkomen. Currently, the team consists of two highly motivated and talented young professionals, and we are looking to further extend the team with two more colleagues. RMD closely cooperates with the other Risk Management teams (focused on Financial Risk, Enterprise Risk and Operational Risk), which as a whole consists of 30 professionals, with varying expertise and nationalities, ranging from young talents to experienced seniors. The atmosphere is open and informal, allowing you to take the initiative!
Continue developing
It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career as well as a person. We help you with:
Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre
A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you
The autonomy to set out your own development path
Employee benefits
You are more than a colleague and that is something we understand very well at NN. You have many roles in life, leading to different choices. At NN we give you the opportunity to select employee benefits that are important to you. For instance, buying additional leave days and flexible working hours. In consultation with your manager and your direct colleagues, you are able to work out of any location at any time. You get enough flexibility to adjust your working pattern to your personal needs. Also, part of the benefits are allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use. In addition, you will receive:
Collective pension scheme with a personal contribution of only 6%
194.4 hours of leave, based on a 36-hour week (that’s 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week) and one Diversity Day
Holiday allowance and a 13th month, paid with your monthly salary
NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel 7 days a week. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometres travelled for business and commuting
At NN we work hybrid. We combine working from home and working in the office. Teams can meet online or in person. You and your team agree on what suits you best. We have set up our offices in such a way that there is a suitable place for every type of work. The official location for this job is The Hague.
As Risk Model Developer you are based in our fantastic office in The Hague. The office is located next to the A12, but is also easily accessible by public transport as well. Want to get some fresh air? You can take the tram or bike and you will be at the beach in half an hour.
Will you be our new colleague?
If you are enthusiastic about this vacancy and think that you would be a good fit for the team at NN, we would like to invite you to apply. We are very keen to find out who you are, what motivates you and what you can contribute to this role at NN.
Apply now
If you have any questions about the vacancy, you can reach out via phone or WhatsApp to Sander Boersma (Manager) via 06-51838926. Any questions about the process can be directed to Andre Komaromi, Recruiter, via 06-12417927.
This is a permanent position. A candidate will receive a contract from NN and we are not open to interim/freelance assignments and/or candidates or recruitment agencies. Thank you very much for your understanding.

Your advice is to the point, very concrete and pragmatic. In this very varied job, you present your solutions to all stakeholders with clear pros and cons. That’s how you make a difference for our management: helping them to benchmark the NN’s risk management practices and processes.

The salary for this position is between € 5176 and € 7394, depending on your knowledge and experience. This is based on a 36-hour work week, excluding a 13th month and vacation pay.
Your impact as an Oversight Actuary of the NN
The most exciting part of this job is de multi-scope role you will have. First and foremost, you are an experienced actuary who will contribute to the execution of the central Actuarial Function within NN Group. In addition, you are the advisor on actuarial matters to the business units and relevant NN Group leadership. In your role you find solutions by connecting the right dots. You take your responsibility and really stand behind your own proposal, with sharp and clear arguments.
Your contributions to the group actuarial reporting are of a high level, predominantly focused on analytics and mainly aimed to provide clear and actionable insights from the actuarial reports to the Group Chief Actuary and other group stakeholders.
The business units can also count on your clear advice on topics like Solvency II models and assumptions, technical provisions, underwriting, reinsurance, ORSA, and more.
All the while, you will play an important role in shaping the scope and implementation of the IFRS17 group Actuarial Function responsibilities and activities going forward. For this part, you will review the IFRS17 liabilities and other metrics and provide advice to the Business Units, Chief Actuary and other corporate functions based on the outcomes.
Our Actuarial Reporting and Oversight team focuses on:
Actuarial SII oversight of business units, focusing on reserving, underwriting and reinsurance practices in the units
Review and guidance on material model and assumption changes
Ownership, maintenance, group-wide implementation and advisory role on policies and standards owned by the Chief Actuary Office (best estimate assumptions, market value of liabilities, Own Funds Movement Analysis, Operating Capital Generation, etc.)
Strengthening the actuarial function/community within the Group, enabling best practice sharing
Contributing to the IFRS17 project, including the development of value metrics and analysis of actuarial choices
And we do a lot more, which gives you great opportunities to develop even further.
Your responsibilities
You will participate in the analysis, review and reporting of actuarial metrics, for internal and external purposes on a recurring basis
You will design/create, maintain/update and advise/guide on actuarial reporting methods, methodologies, policies and standards
You maintain/update the tools, reporting processes and requirements for actuarial metrics
You contribute to the actuarial data-driven oversight of the NN Business Units
You participate in the implementation and roll-out of IFRS17 Actuarial Function related activities, review and challenge financial results and participate in strategic projects where actuarial skills are required
Your colleagues
You become part of our 8-person team, including a trainee. We are quite the international team with four different nationalities. We are all in our twenties and thirties with a good dose of professional skills.
Every Monday, we work at the office; the other days you decide yourself, because that depends on your cooperation with other colleagues within NN. We also have a lot of online contact, like various conferences. Collaboration is a great good within our team: we take on every task with two colleagues.
Every quarter we end with a dinner or a drink because our work-life balance is important as well.
Our Actuarial Reporting and Oversight team is part of the Chief Actuary Office of NN Group. As member of this team you will contribute to execution of the Actuarial Function within NN Group. The Actuarial Function is mainly responsible for the technical provisions of NN Group across the different balance sheets and related metrics.
Who you are
You feel at home at a fast-paced, evolving business and technical environment. As a driven person, you have the mentality to get things done and to connect with others to succeed in your role. We can describe you as a team player with a strong sense of ownership who is hungry for intellectual challenges, and who is concise and biased towards efficiency. You also have:
An academic bachelor's/master’s degree in Econometrics, Actuarial Science, or other quantitative degree
A minimum of 7 years of experience gained in life of non-life insurance and experience in Solvency II valuation and/or reporting (with a focus on SII technical provisions and own funds)
Strong analytical and numerical skills to challenge and explain SII results
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate with senior stakeholders and auditors
Very good command of Excel; other data manipulation tools are a plus
Continue developing
It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career and as a person. We help you with:
Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre
A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you
The autonomy to steer your own development path
Employee benefits
You are more than a colleague, and that is something we understand very well at NN. You have many roles in life, leading to different choices. At NN we give you the opportunity to select employee benefits that are important to you. For instance, buying additional leave days and flexible working hours. In consultation with your manager and your direct colleagues, you can work from any location at any time. You get enough flexibility to adjust your working pattern to your personal needs. Another part of the benefits are (currently online) sports lessons and a special allowance to set up your home office and internet use. In addition, you will receive:
Collective pension scheme with a personal contribution of only 6%
194.4 hours of leave, based on a 36-hour week (that’s 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week) and one Diversity Day
Holiday allowance and a 13th month paid with your monthly salary
NS Business Card 2nd class, giving you unlimited travel 7 days a week. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometres travelled for business and commuting.
All NN colleagues work in a hybrid form: two days at the office and working from home (or anywhere else). The official location for this job is our fantastic office in The Hague. The office is located next to the A12, but is also easily accessible by public transport. Want to catch some fresh air? You can take the tram or bike and you will be at the beach in half an hour.
Will you be our new colleague?
We would like to invite you to come and have a cup of coffee or tea. Because we believe that your enthusiasm about this position will only increase during that conversation. So, what are you waiting for?
